decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. It aims to flood the board with small, cheap creatures such as Hordeling Outburst, Dragon Fodder, and Monastery Swiftspear, then use burn spells like Wild Slash and Fiery Impulse to clear the way for them to attack. Cards like Titan's Strength and Become Immense provide additional damage boosts, while Atarka's Command can be used both offensively and defensively. Overall, the deck's goal is to deal as much damage as possible in a short amount of time to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on accelerating its mana production with cards like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Explosive Vegetation to ramp up to powerful creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. It also includes removal spells like Titan's Presence and Spatial Contortion to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its big threats and card advantage from cards like Hedron Archive and Sanctum of Ugin, ultimately controlling the game and winning through powerful creatures and spells.

Control the game with a combination of removal spells, card draw, and counterspells. Use your powerful creatures like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Monastery Mentor to generate value and pressure your opponent. Manage your resources carefully, utilizing Treasure Cruise and Painful Truths to refuel your hand. Crackling Doom and other removal spells keep the board clear while cards like Duress disrupt your opponent's plans. Finish the game with a combination of burn spells and powerful threats like Chandra, Flamecaller and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on efficiently deploying threats onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal and combat tricks. With a mix of powerful creatures like Anafenza, the Foremost and Den Protector, along with versatile spells like Abzan Charm and Collected Company, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game. The mana base provides a solid foundation for casting the deck's spells consistently, allowing for aggressive plays and strategic combat interactions.

The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Siege Rhino, Reflector Mage, and Anafenza, the Foremost, while also utilizing disruption spells like Stubborn Denial and Reflector Mage to control the board. The deck also includes some card advantage and flexibility with Den Protector and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and support, while the mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements with fetch lands and dual lands.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various removal spells and counters, while utilizing efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Den Protector to apply pressure. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Nissa, Vastwood Seer for additional card advantage and board presence. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's diverse color requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of card advantage, removal, and threats.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient removal spells and burn spells to control the board and push damage through to the opponent. The creatures in the deck have high power and evasion, allowing for quick and impactful attacks. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, enabling the deck to deploy threats early and maintain pressure throughout the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Duress provides disruption against control and combo decks, allowing for adaptability in various matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells to deal damage efficiently and effectively. By utilizing cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Titan's Strength, along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Stormchaser Mage, the deck aims to quickly build up damage and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes card draw spells like Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. This deck prioritizes speed and aggression to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Rally the Ancestors to bring back a variety of creatures from the graveyard, including Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, to create a powerful combo. Cards like Collected Company and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy are used to help find key pieces and fuel the graveyard. The deck aims to flood the board with creatures, sacrifice them for value with Nantuko Husk, and trigger powerful abilities like Zulaport Cutthroat's draining effect to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the help of cards like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Explosive Vegetation to cast powerful threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The control aspect of the deck is reinforced with cards like Kozilek's Return and World Breaker to deal with opposing threats, while also utilizing cards like Shrine of the Forsaken Gods and Sanctum of Ugin to search for additional powerful Eldrazi creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and control the board to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using Rally the Ancestors to bring back multiple creatures from the graveyard at once, creating a powerful combo. The key strategy is to use cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk alongside Rally the Ancestors to quickly drain your opponent's life total. The deck also features cards like Reflector Mage and Collected Company to control the board and find key combo pieces. By carefully timing your Rally the Ancestors and utilizing your creatures effectively, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their hand with discard spells. By utilizing efficient removal and powerful Eldrazi creatures, the deck aims to control the board and apply pressure quickly. The lands in the deck also provide utility and additional ways to generate advantage. The focus is on playing aggressively and efficiently to outpace the opponent and dominate the game.

The deck focuses on establishing a powerful board presence by casting Rally the Ancestors to bring back multiple creatures from the graveyard. By using cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, the deck can drain opponent's life total quickly. The deck also includes cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage to provide additional value and disruption. The key strategy is to set up a combo that can deal a significant amount of damage in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent and securing a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells and powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By consistently removing threats and generating card advantage through card draw and token production, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through attrition. The inclusion of lifelink creatures and lands like Shambling Vent also helps to stabilize the player's life total while pressuring the opponent. With a well-timed board wipe or planeswalker ultimate, the deck can assert dominance and secure the victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up your graveyard with creatures, then bringing them back all at once with Rally the Ancestors to overwhelm your opponent. You can then use cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk to drain your opponent's life total while generating value from sacrificing your own creatures. Cards like Collected Company help you dig for the pieces you need, while cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Reflector Mage provide additional value and disruption. The goal is to create a powerful combo that can end the game in a single turn.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Ruin in Their Wake, Nissa's Pilgrimage, and Explosive Vegetation in order to cast powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon early in the game. The deck also utilizes control elements like Kozilek's Return and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing the green ramp strategy and incorporating control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while managing the game state.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through removal spells and powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Goblin Dark-Dwellers. It also utilizes the abilities of Soulfire Grand Master to gain life and recast spells from the graveyard. The mana base is built around fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and outvalue them with efficient removal and resilient threats. By managing the game state and using resources wisely, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield and secure victory.

This deck focuses on maintaining control of the game by utilizing a mixture of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats. By constantly removing opposing threats with cards like Crackling Doom and Roast, while also disrupting their game plan with Duress and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent over time. The inclusion of cards like Siege Rhino and Soulfire Grand Master provide additional resilience and win conditions, ensuring a steady stream of threats and answers throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to focus on control through a combination of creature removal, hand disruption, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Crackling Doom, Fiery Impulse, Kolaghan's Command, and Duress to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw options like Treasure Cruise and Painful Truths to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent. The key strategy is to outlast the opponent by removing threats and generating card advantage until the win condition can be secured.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early control through removal spells and disruption, while also having the ability to generate card advantage through recursion with Goblin Dark-Dwellers and Soulfire Grand Master. The deck aims to maintain board presence and apply pressure with versatile spells like Crackling Doom and Kolaghan's Command. The mana base is designed to support the heavy color requirements of the deck, allowing for consistent casting of both removal and creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing its own threats on the battlefield.

This combo deck utilizes Rally the Ancestors to bring back key cards like Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk from the graveyard to create a lethal board state. Cards like Sidisi's Faithful and Reflector Mage provide control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Grim Haruspex and Collected Company help draw cards and find important pieces. Liliana, Heretical Healer and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy help with graveyard recursion and card advantage. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and life drain effects.

The deck focuses on utilizing Rally the Ancestors to bring back a combination of creatures, mainly Zulaport Cutthroat and Nantuko Husk, to generate a lethal combo that drains the opponent's life total. The deck includes key cards like Collected Company and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy to help dig for combo pieces and control the board. By sacrificing creatures like Catacomb Sifter and Elvish Visionary with Nantuko Husk, the deck can create a powerful loop that overwhelms the opponent with damage and card advantage.

This Aggro Abzan deck focuses on aggressively building up your board presence with powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Warden of the First Tree, and Anafenza, Kin-Tree Spirit. The deck also includes strong removal spells like Murderous Cut and Abzan Charm to control the board and keep your opponent on the back foot. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and creates tokens to pressure your opponent. The deck's mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and creatures, ensuring a strong and relentless aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of removal and creature buffs. It aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, while using Abzan Charm and Silkwrap to deal with threats. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar for additional board presence. The mana base supports the three-color Abzan strategy with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. Overall, the deck prioritizes fast, proactive plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on generating a strong board presence and using efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Anafenza, the Foremost to pressure the opponent quickly. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar for additional threats. The deck includes control elements like Silkwrap and Abzan Charm to deal with opposing threats, while also incorporating mana fixing lands to ensure consistent color access. The overall strategy revolves around playing aggressively and maintaining a steady stream of pressure to overwhelm the opponent in a Standard 1 vs 1 matchup.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with creatures like Siege Rhino, Anafenza, and Warden of the First Tree, while also using removal spells like Murderous Cut and Silkwrap to control the board. The deck also has some flexibility with cards like Sorin, Solemn Visitor and Dromoka's Command for added value and combat tricks. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for the deck to hit its curve effectively. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain it throughout the game to overwhelm the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by burn spells and combat tricks. By playing efficient and low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Abbot of Keral Keep, along with powerful burn spells like Wild Slash and Exquisite Firecraft, you aim to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Temur Battle Rage and Become Immense can provide additional bursts of damage to finish your opponent off quickly. Overall, this deck is designed to be fast, aggressive, and relentless in attacking your opponent.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using powerful dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar to dominate the battlefield. It also utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and draw spells to control the opponent's actions and maintain board presence. With a combination of creatures, spells, and lands that produce multiple colors of mana, this deck aims to outlast and outplay opponents through strategic decision-making and resource management. It is designed to gradually wear down the opponent's resources while building up its own advantage to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Seeker of the Way, Mantis Rider, and Wingmate Roc, supported by powerful planeswalkers Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. There is also a mix of cheap removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to help maintain board control and push through damage quickly. The mana base allows for consistency in casting spells and creatures while providing access to all three colors of the Jeskai color combination. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively with a mix of removal spells and efficient creatures with the aim to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The deck utilizes powerful cards like Crackling Doom and Kolaghan's Command to control the board while applying pressure with creatures like Pia and Kiran Nalaar, Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, and Seeker of the Way. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana with cards like Ruin in Their Wake, Nissa's Pilgrimage, and Explosive Vegetation, allowing you to cast powerful creatures and spells ahead of your opponent. The control aspect comes from cards like Kozilek's Return and World Breaker, which can help you control the board while you build up your mana base. The end game plan is to summon huge threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and burning spells. The key strategy is to utilize cheap, efficient creatures like Zurgo Bellstriker and Forerunner of Slaughter to deal damage early on, while using burn spells like Draconic Roar and Wild Slash to remove blockers or finish off opponents. The creatures in the deck have abilities that help to maintain momentum and provide extra value, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can set up a defense.
